content.question: Humans are warned to shield their eyes from ultraviolet radiation with wavelengths shorter than <math alttext="300 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> but not from infrared radiation with wavelengths of about <math alttext="900 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>900</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following explains the reason for this based on what happens at the molecular level with exposure to these types of radiation?

choices.label: <math alttext="900 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>900</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> radiation has triple the energy of <math alttext="300 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> radiation, so infrared radiation is more likely to promote electrons or break covalent bonds.
